suncertify.commons
Class Command<V,S>

java.lang.Object
  suncertify.commons.LoggingObject
      suncertify.commons.Command<V,S>
Type Parameters:
V - Receiver class, class of the target object.
S - Class of the target method return type.
Direct Known Subclasses:
BusinessCommand
public abstract class Command<V,S>
extends LoggingObject

Instances of this class represent receiver class (V parameter) methods calls. Encapsulating method calls in Command objects makes possible to establish an immutable framework that does not need to be recoded every time a new operation is needed, ie improves the extensibility of the system.

Subclasses must implement the protected method:

  • protected abstract S doExecute() throws Exception;
Exception handling is provided by this class so subclasses must leave possible exceptions unhandled.

Subclasses can overwrite the following protected methods:

  • protected void doPreExecution() throws Exception
  • protected void doPostExecution() throws Exception
These life-cycle methods are called just before and after receiver's method delegation, so usually are overwritten to perform validations and resource allocation/deallocation.

A reference to the receiver object is given under the protected instance field "receiver". This field is updated prior to any of the previous methods invocation.

Instances of this class are not thread safe, and are not mean to be shared among different threads.

Version:
1.0 11/10/2010
Author:
Ignacio del Valle Alles
See Also:
Command Pattern

Method Detail

execute

public final void execute(V receiver)
                   throws Exception
Called by the invoker of the command.

Parameters:
receiver - the target object that will resolve the request.
Throws:
Exception - if an error occurs.

getResult

public S getResult()
This method returns the result of command execution. Is used in asynchronous command executions.

Returns:
the object returned by the target method of the receiver.

getException

public Exception getException()
This method returns the exception thrown in command execution. Is used in asynchronous command executions.

Returns:
the exception thrown by the target method of the receiver.
